Package com.mathmaster13.fynotek

Class FynotekWord

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mathmaster13.fynotek.FynotekWord
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ModernFynotekWord, OldFynotekWord
    public abstract class FynotekWord
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for handling words in Fynotek, a conlang by mochaspen, in both its modern and old form.

      • markVowel

        protected char markVowel
        The vowel that a FynotekWord was marked with through ablaut. A non-marked word uses the value '␀', and a word marked by reduplication ablaut uses 'r'. This field should not be modified by a programmer unless they make a different implementation of the match method.
        See Also:
        isMarked(), match(FynotekWord), ablaut(char)

      • FynotekWord

        protected FynotekWord​(java.lang.String a,
                      java.lang.String b,
                      java.lang.String c,
                      char mark)
        Creates a FynotekWord and sets its parameters to those provided.
        Parameters:
        a - the part of a word before its final vowel or diphthong.
        b - a word's final vowel or diphthong.
        c - the part of a word after its final vowel or diphthong.
        mark - the character to set markVowel to.
        See Also:
        beginning, vowels, end, markVowel

        Converts a String into a FynotekWord, and marks the word as having the specified ablaut.
        Parameters:
        word - word to be converted to a FynotekWord.
        mark - the type of ablaut this word has.

        See Also:

      • getNonHypoTense

        protected abstract char getNonHypoTense​(char tense)
        An internal-use method used in verbTense. It is not recommended to use this method when extending this class. As such, documentation will not be provided. When extending this class, one can simply make this method return '␀' or something similar.

      • isVowel

        protected static boolean isVowel​(char letter)
        Checks if a given character is a vowel. Specifically, returns true if and only if the given character is 'a', 'e', 'i', 'o', 'u', or 'y'.
        Parameters:
        letter - the character to be checked for whether it is a vowel or not.
        Returns:
        true if and only if letter is a vowel.

      • isValidSequence

        protected static boolean isValidSequence​(java.lang.String sequence,
                                         java.lang.String regex,
                                         byte maxConsonants,
                                         boolean checkForSameConsonants)
        A back-end for the isValidSequence functions in this class' subclasses. Not recommended to be used if a programmer extends this class. As such, implementation details will not be provided.
        Returns:
        true if sequence is a valid sequence, and false if not.
        See Also:
        OldFynotekWord.isValidSequence(String), ModernFynotekWord.isValidSequence(String)

      • verbTense

        public FynotekWord verbTense​(char tenseOfVerb,
                             boolean hypothetical)
        Returns this FynotekWord inflected for the verb tense specified by tenseOfVerb. tenseOfVerb should be either 'p' (present), 'a' (past), 'f' (future), or 'g' (gnomic). All other charcters will cause the original object to be returned. If hypothetical is set to true, the word will be marked for a hypothetical tense; otherwise, the word will be inflected for a non-hypothetical tense. If the word is an OldFynotekWord, verbTense('g', false) and verbTense('g', true) will always return the same result. It is recommended to override this implementation if a programmer extends this class.
        Parameters:
        tenseOfVerb - the verb tense to inflect this FynotekWord for.
        hypothetical - whether this word should be inflected for a hypothetical tense or not.
        Returns:
        this FynotekWord inflected for the specified verb tense.
        See Also:
        match(FynotekWord)

      • verbTense

        public FynotekWord verbTense​(char tenseOfVerb)
        Returns this FynotekWord inflected for the non-hypothetical verb tense specified by tenseOfVerb. tenseOfVerb should be either 'p' (present), 'a' (past), 'f' (future), or 'g' (gnomic). All other charcters will cause the original object to be returned.
        Parameters:
        tenseOfVerb - the verb tense to inflect this FynotekWord for.
        Returns:
        this FynotekWord inflected for the specified verb tense.
        See Also:
        match(FynotekWord)

      • match

        public FynotekWord match​(FynotekWord word)
        Returns this FynotekWord inflected for the same case or tense as word. It is recommended to override this implementation if a programmer extends this class.
        Parameters:
        word - the FynotekWord to match this word's inflection with.
        Returns:
        this FynotekWord inflected for the same case or tense as word.
        See Also:
        verbTense(char, boolean)

      • isMarked

        public boolean isMarked()
        Returns whether this FynotekWord is marked or not. Specifically, returns (markVowel != '␀').
        Returns:
        true if this FynotekWord is marked for case or tense, and false if not.
        See Also:
        markVowel

      • personSuffix

        public abstract FynotekWord personSuffix​(int person)
        Returns this FynotekWord with a suffix added to mark the first, second, or third person.
        Parameters:
        person - the person to mark this word for. Can only be 1, 2, or 3.
        Returns:
        this FynotekWord with a suffix added to mark the first, second, or third person.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the person specified is a value other than 1, 2, or 3.
        See Also:
        verbTense(char, boolean)
